sense.name: (cause to) separate or move in different directions
sense.examples: The gendarmes drew their swords, charged and dispersed the crowd. They dispersed the main discussion in four separate directions. A small body of troops arrived late last night and dispersed the rioters. The levies mutinied and dispersed.

sense.name: distribute; make known
sense.examples: The airplane dispersed the leaflets over the city. She dispersed knowledge to everyone she met.
